channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Goal-oriented Autonomous Driving
item.description: Modern autonomous driving system is characterized as modular tasks in sequential order, i. e., perception, prediction and planning.

item.title: Precise Zero-Shot Dense Retrieval without Relevance Labels
item.description: Given a query, HyDE first zero-shot instructs an instruction-following language model (e. g. InstructGPT) to generate a hypothetical document.

item.title: BMX: Boosting Machine Translation Metrics with Explainability
item.description: Hence, recent works consider their explainability with the goals of better understandability for humans and better metric analysis, including failure cases.

item.title: Interleaving Retrieval with Chain-of-Thought Reasoning for Knowledge-Intensive Multi-Step Questions
item.description: This is insufficient, however, when the necessary knowledge is not available or up-to-date within a model's parameters.

item.title: Which Pixel to Annotate: a Label-Efficient Nuclei Segmentation Framework
item.description: Recently deep neural networks, which require a large amount of annotated samples, have been widely applied in nuclei instance segmentation of H\&E stained pathology images.

item.title: Towards Robustness of Text-to-SQL Models Against Natural and Realistic Adversarial Table Perturbation
item.description: The robustness of Text-to-SQL parsers against adversarial perturbations plays a crucial role in delivering highly reliable applications.

item.title: Variational Factorization Machines for Preference Elicitation in Large-Scale Recommender Systems
item.description: Factorization machines (FMs) are a powerful tool for regression and classification in the context of sparse observations, that has been successfully applied to collaborative filtering, especially when side information over users or items is available.

item.title: Towards Reasoning in Large Language Models: A Survey
item.description: Reasoning is a fundamental aspect of human intelligence that plays a crucial role in activities such as problem solving, decision making, and critical thinking.

item.title: Self-adaptive In-context Learning
item.description: Despite the surprising few-shot performance of in-context learning (ICL), it is still a common practice to randomly sample examples to serve as context.

item.title: Graph Neural Networks in Computer Vision -- Architectures, Datasets and Common Approaches
item.description: Firstly, we investigate the architectures of Graph Neural Networks and their derivatives used in this area to provide accurate and explainable recommendations for the ensuing investigations.

item.title: Modeling Human Eye Movements with Neural Networks in a Maze-Solving Task
item.description: This not only provides a generative model of eye movements in this task but also suggests a computational theory for how humans solve the task, namely that humans use mental simulation.

item.title: Unleashing the Power of Visual Prompting At the Pixel Level
item.description: This paper presents a simple and effective visual prompting method for adapting pre-trained models to downstream recognition tasks.

item.title: DOC: Improving Long Story Coherence With Detailed Outline Control
item.description: In human evaluations of automatically generated stories, DOC substantially outperforms a strong Re3 baseline (Yang et al., 2022) on plot coherence (22. 5% absolute gain), outline relevance (28. 2%), and interestingness (20. 7%).

item.title: Large Language Models Are Reasoning Teachers
item.description: We propose Fine-tune-CoT, a method that leverages the capabilities of very large LMs to generate reasoning samples and teach smaller models via fine-tuning.

item.title: A Comparison Between Tsetlin Machines and Deep Neural Networks in the Context of Recommendation Systems
item.description: These comparisons are based on model performance, interpretability/explainability, and scalability.

item.title: Exploring the Challenges of Open Domain Multi-Document Summarization
item.description: Multi-document summarization (MDS) has traditionally been studied assuming a set of ground-truth topic-related input documents is provided.

item.title: ADAS: A Simple Active-and-Adaptive Baseline for Cross-Domain 3D Semantic Segmentation
item.description: State-of-the-art 3D semantic segmentation models are trained on the off-the-shelf public benchmarks, but they often face the major challenge when these well-trained models are deployed to a new domain.

item.title: Toward a Unified Framework for Unsupervised Complex Tabular Reasoning
item.description: To bridge the gap between the programs and natural language sentences, we design a powerful "NL-Generator" module to generate natural language sentences with complex logic from these programs.

item.title: True Detective: A Challenging Benchmark for Deep Abductive Reasoning \\in Foundation Models
item.description: Our work provides a challenging benchmark for future studies on reasoning in language models and contributes to a better understanding of the limits of LLMs' abilities.

item.title: On Improving Summarization Factual Consistency from Natural Language Feedback
item.description: In this work, we study whether informational feedback in natural language can be leveraged to improve generation quality and user preference alignment.

item.title: Galaxy Image Classification using Hierarchical Data Learning with Weighted Sampling and Label Smoothing
item.description: With the development of a series of Galaxy sky surveys in recent years, the observations increased rapidly, which makes the research of machine learning methods for galaxy image recognition a hot topic.

item.title: When Federated Learning Meets Pre-trained Language Models' Parameter-Efficient Tuning Methods
item.description: To facilitate the research of PETuning in FL, we also develop a federated tuning framework FedPETuning, which allows practitioners to exploit different PETuning methods under the FL training paradigm conveniently.

item.title: Benchmarking person re-identification datasets and approaches for practical real-world implementations
item.description: Recently, Person Re-Identification (Re-ID) has received a lot of attention.

item.title: When Not to Trust Language Models: Investigating Effectiveness and Limitations of Parametric and Non-Parametric Memories
item.description: Despite their impressive performance on diverse tasks, large language models (LMs) still struggle with tasks requiring rich world knowledge, implying the limitations of relying solely on their parameters to encode a wealth of world knowledge.

item.title: Self-Pair: Synthesizing Changes from Single Source for Object Change Detection in Remote Sensing Imagery
item.description: For change detection in remote sensing, constructing a training dataset for deep learning models is difficult due to the requirements of bi-temporal supervision.

item.title: ReCode: Robustness Evaluation of Code Generation Models
item.description: Most existing works on robustness in text or code tasks have focused on classification, while robustness in generation tasks is an uncharted area and to date there is no comprehensive benchmark for robustness in code generation.

item.title: HyperBO+: Pre-training a universal prior for Bayesian optimization with hierarchical Gaussian processes
item.description: However, those prior learning methods typically assume that the input domains are the same for all tasks, weakening their ability to use observations on functions with different domains or generalize the learned priors to BO on different search spaces.

item.title: Insights into undergraduate pathways using course load analytics
item.description: Course load analytics (CLA) inferred from LMS and enrollment features can offer a more accurate representation of course workload to students than credit hours and potentially aid in their course selection decisions.

item.title: Pre-trained Language Models for Keyphrase Generation: A Thorough Empirical Study
item.description: However, there lacks a systematic study of how the two types of approaches compare and how different design choices can affect the performance of PLM-based models.

item.title: Causal Inference for Knowledge Graph based Recommendation
item.description: Knowledge Graph (KG), as a side-information, tends to be utilized to supplement the collaborative filtering (CF) based recommendation model.

item.title: Using Machine Learning to Determine Morphologies of $z<1$ AGN Host Galaxies in the Hyper Suprime-Cam Wide Survey
item.description: The classification precision of our models has a noticeable dependency on host galaxy radius and magnitude.

item.title: DimonGen: Diversified Generative Commonsense Reasoning for Explaining Concept Relationships
item.description: In this paper, we propose DimonGen, which aims to generate diverse sentences describing concept relationships in various everyday scenarios.

item.title: Self-Instruct: Aligning Language Model with Self Generated Instructions
item.description: Applying our method to vanilla GPT3, we demonstrate a 33% absolute improvement over the original model on Super-NaturalInstructions, on par with the performance of InstructGPT_001, which is trained with private user data and human annotations.

item.title: Towards Understanding Chain-of-Thought Prompting: An Empirical Study of What Matters
item.description: Chain-of-Thought (CoT) prompting can dramatically improve the multi-step reasoning abilities of large language models (LLMs).

item.title: Flowstorm: Open-Source Platform with Hybrid Dialogue Architecture
item.description: One of the essential features of the platform is the possibility to reuse the created assets across applications.

item.title: Probability package for Macaulay2
item.description: We introduce the Probability package for Macaulay2, which provides an interface for users to compute probabilities and generate random variates from a wide variety of univariate probability distributions.

item.title: Reasoning with Language Model Prompting: A Survey
item.description: Reasoning, as an essential ability for complex problem-solving, can provide back-end support for various real-world applications, such as medical diagnosis, negotiation, etc.

item.title: Learning Object-level Point Augmentor for Semi-supervised 3D Object Detection
item.description: In this work, we propose an object-level point augmentor (OPA) that performs local transformations for semi-supervised 3D object detection.

item.title: Transferring General Multimodal Pretrained Models to Text Recognition
item.description: This paper proposes a new method, OFA-OCR, to transfer multimodal pretrained models to text recognition.

item.title: NusaCrowd: Open Source Initiative for Indonesian NLP Resources
item.description: We present NusaCrowd, a collaborative initiative to collect and unite existing resources for Indonesian languages, including opening access to previously non-public resources.

item.title: Dynamic Sparse Network for Time Series Classification: Learning What to "see''
item.description: The receptive field (RF), which determines the region of time series to be ``seen'' and used, is critical to improve the performance for time series classification (TSC).

item.title: Million-scale Object Detection with Large Vision Model
item.description: Over the past few years, developing a broad, universal, and general-purpose computer vision system has become a hot topic.

item.title: Graph-based Semantical Extractive Text Analysis
item.description: The two important tasks to do this are keyword extraction and text summarization.

item.title: Solving QMLTP Problems by Translation to Higher-order Logic
item.description: This paper describes an evaluation of Automated Theorem Proving (ATP) systems on problems taken from the QMLTP library of first-order modal logic problems.

item.title: Query-as-context Pre-training for Dense Passage Retrieval
item.description: Query-as-context pre-training assumes that the predicted query is a special context for the document and uses contrastive learning or contextual masked auto-encoding learning to compress the document and query into dense vectors.

item.title: Cognitive Accident Prediction in Driving Scenes: A Multimodality Benchmark
item.description: In particular, the text description provides a dense semantic description guidance for the primary context of the traffic scene, while the driver attention provides a traction to focus on the critical region closely correlating with safe driving.

item.title: Answering Complex Logical Queries on Knowledge Graphs via Query Tree Optimization
item.description: In this work, we propose QTO (Query Tree Optimization) that can efficiently find the exact optimal solution.

item.title: BLOOM+1: Adding Language Support to BLOOM for Zero-Shot Prompting
item.description: The BLOOM model is a large open-source multilingual language model capable of zero-shot learning, but its pretraining was limited to 46 languages.

item.title: Latent Diffusion for Language Generation
item.description: Diffusion models have achieved great success in modeling continuous data modalities such as images, audio, and video, but have seen limited use in discrete domains such as language.

item.title: Segmentation Ability Map: Interpret deep features for medical image segmentation
item.description: In addition, our method can provide a mean SA score which can give a performance estimation of the output on the test images without ground-truth.
